title: Trump Admin Orders States to End Expanded SNAP Benefits Amid Shutdown
snippets: The Trump administration late Saturday directed states that they must "immediately undo" any actions they have made to provide benefits to low-income families via SNAP.
The food assistance programme has been caught in a back-and-forth legal battle over funding as the government shutdown drags on.
Trump administration orders states to "undo" full SNAP benefits Axios
The Trump administration has resisted continuing the SNAP program, which provides food stamps to 42 million Americans, during the government shutdown.

U.S. President Donald Trump's administration is demanding states "undo" full SNAP food benefits paid out under judges' orders over the past week, now that the U.S. Supreme Court has stayed those rulings, marking the latest swing in a seesawing legal battle over the anti-hunger program used by 42 mil
Some 42 million Americans rely on SNAP benefits, but payments have become shrouded in uncertainty amid the ongoing government shutdown.
USDA tells states to undo efforts to issue full food aid benefits Reuters
White House threatens to impose financial penalties on states that do not “comply” quickly with its new orders to reverse steps they've taken to issue SNAP benefits.
Trump administration demands states 'undo' full SNAP payouts as states warn of 'catastrophic impact' AP News
titles: Trump admin tells states to 'immediately undo' steps to fund November SNAP benefits
Trump administration tells states to stop paying full food aid benefits
Trump administration orders states to "undo" full SNAP benefits - Axios
Trump administration demands that states 'undo' full SNAP benefit payments
Trump administration wants U.S. states to 'undo' full payouts of SNAP food benefits
The Trump administration orders states to reverse full SNAP benefits sent for November
USDA tells states to undo efforts to issue full food aid benefits - Reuters
Government shutdown updates: USDA tells states to 'undo' issuing any SNAP benefits
Trump administration demands states 'undo' full SNAP payouts as states warn of 'catastrophic impact' - AP News
summary: The Trump administration has ordered states to reverse actions that provided full SNAP (Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program) benefits to low-income families amid the government shutdown. This directive affects 42 million Americans dependent on food stamps. The decision, enforced through potential financial penalties for non-compliance, follows a Supreme Court stay on lower court rulings that had allowed the benefits. This move has sparked concerns over the potential catastrophic impact on those reliant on the program during the shutdown.

title: Israel Confirms Return of Soldier's Remains from Gaza After 11 Years
snippets: Hadar Goldin was killed on Aug. 1, 2014, two hours after a ceasefire took effect ending that year's war between Israel and Hamas.
Israel receives remains of deceased soldier from Gaza Reuters
The Israeli military confirmed the soldier's body had been returned from Gaza after 11 years on Sunday.
Body identified as Israeli soldier Hadar Goldin with the remains of four other deceased captives still in Gaza.
After conducting forensic tests, Israel has confirmed that the remains belong to Hadar Goldin, a soldier killed in Gaza during a humanitarian ceasefire in the 2014 war.
Israel receives remains of deceased hostage Al Arabiya English
titles: Israel receives remains of hostage that Hamas says is IDF soldier killed in 2014
Israel receives remains of deceased soldier from Gaza - Reuters
Israel receives body of soldier killed in 2014 in Gaza
Israel receives remains of soldier killed in Gaza in 2014
Hamas hands over body of soldier killed in 2014 Gaza war
Israel receives remains of deceased hostage - Al Arabiya English
summary: Israel confirmed the return of Hadar Goldin's remains, a soldier killed in Gaza during a 2014 ceasefire, after 11 years. The Israeli military received his body from Gaza, with the remains of four other captives still held. Forensic tests verified the identity of the remains as Goldin's.

title: Former NFL Commissioner Paul Tagliabue Dies at 84
snippets: Paul Tagliabue, who helped bring labor peace and riches to the NFL during his 17 years as commissioner but was criticized for not taking stronger action on concussions, died on Sunday at 84 years old.
Paul Tagliabue, who served as NFL commissioner for 17 seasons as the league experienced tremendous prosperity and growth, died Sunday morning at the age of 84, his family announced.
Tagliabue served as the NFL's commissioner for 17 years before being inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2020
Paul Tagliabue, the NFL commissioner who ran the league for 17 years in an era of riches and expansion, has died at 84.

NEW YORK (AP) — Paul Tagliabue, who helped bring labor peace and riches to the NFL during his 17 years as commissioner but was criticized for not taking stronger action on concussions, died Sunday from heart failure. He was 84. NFL spokesman Brian McCarthy said Tagliabue’s family informed the league
titles: Paul Tagliabue, NFL commissioner for 17 years, dies at 84
Ex-NFL commissioner Tagliabue dies at age 84
Longtime NFL commissioner Paul Tagliabue dies at 84, leaving behind legacy of reshaping the game
Paul Tagliabue, former NFL commissioner for 17 years, dies at 84
Paul Tagliabue, NFL commissioner of 17 years who led an era of riches and expansion, dies at 84
summary: Paul Tagliabue, former NFL commissioner for 17 years and Pro Football Hall of Fame inductee in 2020, died at 84 from heart failure, as confirmed by his family. Tagliabue, known for his role in the league's growth and labor peace, faced criticism for his handling of concussion issues.

title: Super Typhoon Fung-wong Targets Luzon, Philippines; Evacuations Underway
snippets: Super Typhoon Fung-wong, the biggest storm to threaten the Philippines this year, started battering the country's northeastern coast ahead of landfall on Sunday.
Super Typhoon Fung-wong slams into Philippines, two dead Reuters
Typhoon Fung-wong, with sustained winds of 185 km/h (115mph), made landfall on Sunday evening local time.
Super Typhoon Fung-wong slams into Philippines, killing 2 and displacing 1 million AP News
Super Typhoon Fung-wong is approaching the Philippines, forcing nearly a million people to evacuate.
The storm already kills at least one person, disrupts power and forces evacuations of nearly one million people.

The Philippines braced for Fung-wong, set to be its biggest storm this year, just days after Typhoon Kalmaegi devastated the country. Over a million people have fled their homes, and two deaths have been reported.

At least two people found dead as super-typhoon hits Philippines, days after Typhoon Kalmaegi killed at least 224 More than 1 million people have been evacuated from their homes in the Philippines and at least two people have been killed as Typhoon Fung-wong – the second big storm to hit in days – m
Typhoon Fung-wong made landfall on the main island of Luzon, prompting the evacuation of more than one million people, just days after an earlier storm killed over 200.

Super Typhoon Fung-wong slammed ashore Sunday on the northeastern coast of the Philippines, where the massive storm had already left at least two people dead and forced more than a million people to evacuate from flood- and landslide-prone areas, officials said.
Super Typhoon Fung-wong slammed into the Philippines' eastern seaboard on Sunday, the national weather service said, after killing at least two people and forcing more than a million to evacuate.
Fung-Wong Becomes Super Typhoon, Nears Philippine Landfall Bloomberg.com
Nearly a million people have been evacuated and floodwaters were rising in the Philippines on Sunday before Typhoon Fung-wong's expected late-night landfall on the east coast.
titles: Nearly a million people evacuate as Super Typhoon Fung-wong threatens the Philippines
Super Typhoon Fung-wong slams into Philippines, two dead - Reuters
Super typhoon makes landfall in Philippines as nearly a million evacuated
Super Typhoon Fung-wong slams into Philippines, killing 2 and displacing 1 million - AP News
Nearly one million evacuated as Typhoon Fung-wong nears Philippines
As Super Typhoon Fung-wong nears, Philippines on edge
Philippines: Over a million evacuate as super typhoon makes landfall
More than 1 million evacuated in the Philippines as Typhoon Fung-wong makes landfall
Super Typhoon Fung-wong Hits Philippines Days After Last Storm
Super Typhoon Fung-wong hits Philippines after more than 1 million people evacuated
Super Typhoon Fung-wong makes landfall in Philippines
Fung-Wong Becomes Super Typhoon, Nears Philippine Landfall - Bloomberg.com
Philippines evacuates hundreds of thousands as super typhoon nears
summary: Super Typhoon Fung-wong, with sustained winds of 185 km/h, is set to make landfall in the Philippines on Sunday evening, targeting the main island of Luzon. This comes shortly after Typhoon Kalmaegi resulted in 204 deaths. Nearly a million people have been evacuated from the eastern and northern regions due to the threat of life-threatening conditions, including high winds and torrential rain. The Philippines weather bureau has warned of severe impacts as the country braces for its biggest storm of the year.

title: Trump Pledges $2,000 "Dividend" for Americans Amid Tariff Policy Review
snippets: Trump again promises $2,000 tariff dividend as SCOTUS decision looms Axios
Trump says that a “dividend of at least $2000 a person” will be paid to all Americans except for “high-income people.”
Are $2,000 Tariff Dividend Checks Coming? President Trump Says So Investopedia
The Supreme Court heard arguments last week challenging Trump’s controversial tariff policy.
In a post on Truth Social on Sunday, Trump said the payments would be for all but "high income people."

"The $2,000 dividend could come in lots of forms, in lots of ways," Bessent said.

summary: Former President Trump has promised a "dividend" of at least $2,000 for all Americans, excluding high-income individuals, linked to his tariff policy. This statement comes as the Supreme Court reviews challenges to the policy. Trump suggested on Truth Social that the payment could be distributed in various forms, potentially through tax cuts, according to Bloomberg. The final method of distribution remains unspecified.

McLaren driver opens 24-point lead over Oscar Piastri Kimi Antonelli second, Verstappen powers through field Lando Norris won the São Paulo Grand Prix, managing a tense and high-pressure victory from pole position to extend his world championship lead over his McLaren teammate, Oscar Piastri, who fi

title: BBC Leaders Resign After Criticism Over Trump Speech Edit
snippets: The BBC said that director-general Tim Davie and head of news Deborah Turness have resigned after criticism of the broadcaster's editing of a speech by U.S. President Donald Trump.
The head of the BBC and the British broadcaster's top news executive both resigned Sunday after criticism of the way the organization edited a speech by U.S. President Donald Trump.

LONDON (AP) — The head of the BBC and the British broadcaster’s top news executive both resigned Sunday after criticism of the way the organization edited a speech by U.S. President Donald Trump. The BBC said Director-General Tim Davie and news CEO Deborah Turness had both decided to leave the corpo

BBC director, head of news resign after criticism of Trump speech edits
BBC director resigns after criticism of the broadcaster’s editing of a Trump speech
summary: The BBC's Director-General Tim Davie and Head of News Deborah Turness resigned following criticism over the editing of a speech by U.S. President Donald Trump. Their resignations were announced by the BBC and confirmed in a statement on Sunday.

title: BBC Leaders Resign Amid Bias Accusations and Controversial Trump Speech Edit

Exit comes after broadcaster was accused of bias on Trump, the Gaza war and coverage of transgender rights

Davie says departure is ‘my own decision’, while head of news also quits, as BBC prepares to apologise for editing of a Trump speech BBC bias row: how a week of hostile headlines from rightwing media led to resignations Tim Davie, the BBC’s director general, and the head of BBC News have resigned af

summary: Tim Davie, the BBC's director general, and the head of BBC News have resigned amid controversies involving accusations of bias related to Donald Trump, the Gaza war, and transgender rights coverage. Their resignations come as the BBC plans to apologize for the editing of a Trump speech. Davie stated his departure was his own decision. This development follows a week of critical coverage from rightwing media.

title: Cleveland Pitchers Indicted in MLB Bribery Scandal
snippets: Cleveland Guardians pitchers Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz have been indicted on a host of charges related to a scheme to rig bets on pitches thrown in MLB games. Ortiz is in custody.

Two Major League Baseball pitchers were indicted Sunday on charges they took bribes to give sports bettors advance notice of the types of pitches they'd throw and intentionally tossed balls instead of strikes to ensure successful bets.

NEW YORK (AP) — Two Major League Baseball pitchers were indicted Sunday on charges they took bribes to give sports bettors advance notice of the types of pitches they’d throw and intentionally tossed balls instead of strikes to ensure successful bets. Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz, both of whom pitched for the Cleveland Guardians , have been on non-disciplinary paid leave since July while Major League Baseball investigated unusually high in-game betting activity when they pitched. Clase, 27, and Ortiz, 26, were both charged with wire fraud conspiracy, honest services wire fraud conspiracy,...
titles: Guardians' Clase, Ortiz indicted for pitch rigging
Guardians' Clase, Ortiz charged with taking bribes to rig pitches for bettors
Guardians’ Clase, Ortiz indicted on betting-related charges
summary: Cleveland Guardians pitchers Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz were indicted for taking bribes to influence MLB game outcomes by signaling pitch types to bettors and intentionally throwing balls. Both have been on paid leave since July amid an MLB investigation into suspicious betting patterns. Clase and Ortiz face charges including wire fraud conspiracy. Ortiz is currently in custody.

title: Taylor Sets Colts Record, Secures OT Win in Berlin
snippets: Taylor rumbled for 244 yards and three touchdowns in Sunday's overtime win

Running back Jonathan Taylor made history for the Indianapolis Colts to give his team a dramatic 31-25 win in overtime against the Atlanta Falcons on Sunday in the first-ever NFL regular season game in Berlin. Taylor became the player with most rushing touchdowns for the Colts with his second one in
Jonathan Taylor scored a game-winning touchdown in overtime as the Indianapolis Colts beat the Atlanta Falcons 31-25 in a thriller at the Olympic Stadium in Berlin.
Even after a spectacular individual performance, Jonathan Taylor was all about praising his Indianapolis Colts teammates Sunday.
titles: Colts' Jonathan Taylor now chasing history after dominating Falcons in Berlin

summary: Jonathan Taylor led the Indianapolis Colts to a 31-25 overtime victory against the Atlanta Falcons in Berlin, setting a team record for the most rushing touchdowns. Taylor amassed 244 yards and scored three touchdowns, including the game-winner in overtime. His performance was pivotal in the NFL's first regular season game in Berlin, and despite his success, Taylor credited his teammates for the win.

title: Climate Warms Faster Than Expected, Post-Paris Agreement
snippets: The world has changed dramatically in the decade since leaders celebrated a historic climate agreement in Paris a decade ago, but not quite in ways they expected or wanted.

BELEM, Brazil (AP) — The world has changed dramatically in the decade since leaders celebrated a historic climate agreement in Paris a decade ago, but not quite in ways they expected or wanted. Earth’s warming climate has gotten nastier faster than society has been able to wean itself from burning t
titles: Landmark Paris Agreement set a path to slow warming. The world hasn't stayed on it
Landmark Paris Agreement set a path to slow warming. The world hasn’t stayed on it
summary: A decade after the historic Paris climate agreement, the world has seen significant changes, but not as anticipated. The climate has warmed more rapidly than expected, outpacing efforts to reduce reliance on fossil fuels.

summary: Air travel in the U.S. is facing significant disruption, with over 2,500 flights already canceled. The Transportation Secretary warned that flight reductions could reach 20% if the current shutdown continues into next week. Airlines may cut hundreds more flights, potentially slowing air travel to a "trickle" before Thanksgiving, as reported by Axios and observed at major airports nationwide.

Carlos Alcaraz claimed an opening victory at the ATP Finals for the first time, beating Alex de Minaur in straight sets.
Carlos Alcaraz got his bid to win a first ATP Finals crown — and claim the year-end No. 1 ranking — off to a positive start on Sunday with a straight-set victory over Alex de Minaur.

title: Chrystia Freeland Named Canada's Envoy for Ukraine Reconstruction
snippets: The Privy Council Office said Freeland will advise the government on Ukraine's economic reconstruction and the effort to bring home thousands of abducted Ukrainian children.

OTTAWA — Seven weeks ago, Prime Minister Mark Carney assigned former cabinet minister Chrystia Freeland to be Canada’s new special envoy for the reconstruction of Ukraine. Canadians haven’t heard much about the job since, and nothing at all about how Ukraine can be rebuilt while Russia continues its
titles: Freeland exploring Canadian business opportunities to help rebuild Ukraine
Chrystia Freeland tasked with tapping Canadian businesses to help rebuild Ukraine
summary: Former cabinet minister Chrystia Freeland was appointed as Canada's special envoy for Ukraine's reconstruction by Prime Minister Mark Carney seven weeks ago. Her role involves advising the government on the economic rebuilding of Ukraine and efforts to repatriate thousands of abducted Ukrainian children. Details on the progress or plans for Ukraine's reconstruction amid ongoing conflict with Russia have not been publicly shared since the announcement.

A 6.7 magnitude earthquake struck Sunday off Yamada, Japan, the USGS said.

title: Canadiens Snap Losing Streak; Key NHL Players Shine in Latest Games
snippets: The Montreal Canadiens shut down last week's losing streak Saturday night. Their 6-2 victory over the Utah Mammoth showed the team's goaltending was also back on form.
Cole Caufield scored a pair of goals, and Oliver Kapanen and Alex Newhook supplied a goal and an assist each as the Montreal Canadiens defeated the Utah Mammoth 6-2.
Drew O’Connor led the way on offence with a goal and an assist, and Brock Boeser potted the eventual game-winner late in the third period as the Vancouver Canucks edged the Columbus Blue Jackets 4-3.
Tim Stutzle scored a pair of goals, including the game-winner, as the Ottawa Senators edged the Philadelphia Flyers 3-2 in overtime.
Arseny Gritsyuk scored a greasy goal and Jake Allen made 33 saves, then added two more in the shootout as the New Jersey Devils shut down the Pittsburgh Penguins 2-1.
Chandler Stephenson tied the game up with less than a second remaining and Shane Wright ended it by scoring the game-winning goal in overtime to help the Seattle Kraken beat the St. Louis Blues 4-3.
Bo Horvat scored a pair of goals, and Ilya Sorokin turned aside 34 shots to earn his first shutout of the season as the New York Islanders blanked the New York Rangers 5-0.
Wyatt Johnston and Miro Heiskanen each dished out two assists and Mavrik Borque finished with a goal and an assist of his own to elevate the Dallas Stars to a 5-4 win over the Nashville Predators.
Andrei Vasilevskiy made 29 saves, while Brandon Hagel and Jake Guentzel each had a goal and an assist to help the Tampa Bay Lightning beat the Washington Capitals 3-2.

Will Smith dished out two assists, Macklin Celebrini extended his goal-scoring streak to three games with a tally, and Yaroslav Askarov stopped 38 shots to lead the San Jose Sharks to a 3-1 win over the Florida Panthers.
Leo Carlsson added a goal and three points to his season tally, Jacob Trouba buried the overtime winner, and the Anaheim Ducks took a 4-3 win over the Vegas Golden Knights.
Andrei Svechnikov, Jesperi Kotkaniemi and Charles-Alexis Legault each recorded a goal and an assist on the night, and the Carolina Hurricanes took a 6-3 win over the Buffalo Sabres.
Morgan Geekie scored his 11th goal of the season, and Fraser Minten buried a huge insurance goal against his former team as the Boston Bruins defeated the Toronto Maple Leafs 5-3.
titles: Call of the Wilde: Montreal Canadiens tame the Utah Mammoth
NHL Highlights: Canadiens 6, Mammoth 2
NHL Highlights: Canucks 4, Blue Jackets 3
NHL Highlights: Senators 3, Flyers 2 (OT)
NHL Highlights: Devils 2, Penguins 1 (SO)
NHL Highlights: Kraken 4, Blues 3 (OT)
NHL Highlights: Islanders 5, Rangers 0
NHL Highlights: Stars 5, Predators 4
NHL Highlights: Lightning 3, Capitals 2
NHL Highlights: Sharks 3, Panthers 1
NHL Highlights: Ducks 4, Golden Knights 3 (OT)
NHL Highlights: Hurricanes 6, Sabres 3
NHL Highlights: Bruins 5, Maple Leafs 3
summary: The Montreal Canadiens ended their losing streak with a 6-2 win over the Utah Mammoth, showcasing strong goaltending. Key players across various teams contributed to their respective victories in the NHL: Cole Caufield (Canadiens) scored twice, Tim Stutzle (Senators) netted the game-winner in overtime, and Ilya Sorokin (Islanders) earned a shutout against the Rangers. Other notable performances included Shane Wright's overtime winner for the Seattle Kraken and Andrei Vasilevskiy's 29 saves for the Tampa Bay Lightning. Wins were also secured by the Devils, Stars, Sharks, Ducks, Hurricanes, and

titles: Snow Set to Wallop Chicago as Cold Blast Aims for East Coast - Bloomberg.com
Snow Set to Wallop Chicago as Cold Blast Aims for East Coast
summary: Heavy snow is forecasted for Chicago, impacting late Sunday to Monday's commute and potentially worsening air travel delays due to the US government shutdown. This will precede a cold wave hitting the East Coast, bringing near-freezing temperatures to New York City, Florida, and Texas.

title: Apple to Expand Satellite Features for iPhones Beyond Texts and Calls
snippets: Apple Plans Major New Satellite-Powered Features for iPhones Bloomberg.com

While Apple’s iPhone already supports texting, calling emergency services, and contacting roadside assistance via satellite connectivity, the company may have many more satellite-powered features in the works.
titles: Apple Plans Major New Satellite-Powered Features for iPhones - Bloomberg.com
Apple reportedly plans ambitious satellite-powered iPhone features
summary: Apple is reportedly expanding its satellite-powered features for iPhones, beyond its current capabilities of texting, emergency calls, and roadside assistance. This indicates a broader use of satellite connectivity in future services.

title: Microbial Life Found in Extreme pH Environment; Quantum Signal Study Succeeds
snippets: Deep beneath the ocean, scientists uncovered thriving microbial life in one of Earth’s harshest environments—an area with a pH of 12, where survival seems nearly impossible. A new study demonstrates that transmitting quantum signals from Earth to a satellite is achievable, opening the door to more robust quantum communication networks. Quantum satellites are currently used to transmit entangled light particles from space to multiple ground stations, creating ultra-secur
titles: Life found in a place scientists thought impossible
Thought to Be Impossible: Scientists Show Quantum Light Could Be Beamed Up to Space
summary: Scientists discovered microbial life in a harsh undersea environment with a pH of 12, showing survival through methane and sulfate metabolism, identified by lipid biomarkers. Concurrently, a study confirmed the feasibility of transmitting quantum signals from Earth to satellites, enhancing the potential for secure quantum communication networks.

title: University of Stuttgart Develops High-Efficiency, Compact Laser
snippets: A team at the University of Stuttgart has engineered a compact short-pulse laser that achieves up to 80% efficiency—far surpassing current models. Their new multipass design reuses light within a small crystal, combining power and precision in a palm-sized system. It opens the door to portable, cost

Researchers have developed an innovative and versatile system designed for a new generation of short-pulse lasers. Lasers that produce extremely short bursts of light are known for their remarkable precision, making them indispensable tools in manufacturing, medical technology, and scientific resear
titles: Tiny laser could transform medicine and quantum science
How a Palm-Sized Laser Could Change Medicine and Manufacturing
summary: Researchers at the University of Stuttgart have developed a compact, short-pulse laser with up to 80% efficiency, significantly higher than existing models. By utilizing a new multipass design that recycles light within a small crystal, this palm-sized system combines high power with precision. This advancement promises to enhance applications in manufacturing, medical technology, and scientific research by making short-pulse lasers more portable and cost-effective.
